questions.question: When I reached the station, the train ……………….. already ………………….
questions.description: The past perfect is used to show that one action had completed before another action commenced.

questions.question: Do you know why …………………………….. angry with me?
questions.description: In indirect questions, the auxiliary verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: I couldn’t help …………………………. when I saw his funny hairstyle.
questions.description: The ing form is used after couldn't help...

questions.question: By the end of this week, he ……………………………… his work.
questions.description: The future perfect is used to say that an activity will have completed by a certain point of time in future.

questions.question: As the population grows, the demand for resources ……………………………..
questions.description: Use simple tenses in both clauses to talk about two situations that develop simultaneously.

questions.question: She won’t finish it ……………………………. tomorrow.
questions.description: Either till or until is possible here.

questions.question: The two girls quarrel with ………………………… whenever they meet.
questions.description: Use each other to talk about two people or things.

questions.question: It is no use …………………………. with her.
…………………………….. you marry, make sure that he is loyal to you.
…………………………… we went, we found the people friendly.
questions.description: Wherever means it doesn't matter where.

questions.question: ……………………………. cold it is, he always goes swimming.
questions.description: However cold means it doesn't matter how cold it is.

questions.question: Bring me the book …………………………….. is on the table.
questions.description: Either which or that is possible here.
